intro: Gilia splendens, commonly known as the splendour gilia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from red to orange and yellow. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is well adapted to arid environments. Its flowers are borne in clusters at the ends of stems, and it produces small, oval-shaped seeds. Gilia splendens is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
